section: A. CONSULTANT'S "ENDORSEMENT" means the right to use the CONSULTANT'S name, fame, nickname, autograph, voice, facsimile, signature, photograph, likeness, and image solely in print advertising campaigns for ADAMS GOLF'S PRODUCT. This excludes any personal appearances or television commercials.
explanation: The definition of "ENDORSEMENT" is limited to print advertising, explicitly excluding personal appearances or television commercials. However, section 11 discusses promotional appearances, including TV and radio appearances, where the Consultant is expected to promote ADAMS GOLF's products. This creates an in-text contradiction.

section: A. CONSULTANT'S "ENDORSEMENT" means the right to use the CONSULTANT'S name, fame, nickname, autograph, voice, facsimile, signature, photograph, likeness, and image solely in print advertising campaigns for ADAMS GOLF'S PRODUCT. This excludes any personal appearances or television commercials.
explanation: The agreement uses the term “endorsement” to define the consultant’s obligations, but it never defines or discusses the consultant’s rights. This is a structural flaw that affects the legal terms.

section: During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall exclusively play/use the MANDATORY PRODUCT whenever practical. The decision on whether to use the MANDATORY PRODUCT in a specific tournament will be at the sole discretion of the CONSULTANT based on performance considerations. (It is expressly understood by the parties that CONSULTANT may play [* ****] clubs in the bag other than ADAMS GOLF clubs including, but not limited to, a putter by a manufacturer other than ADAMS GOLF but may not endorse those clubs and/or putter.)
explanation: The first sentence states that the consultant 'shall exclusively play/use the MANDATORY PRODUCT whenever practical,' which implies a general obligation. However, the second sentence grants the consultant sole discretion on whether to use the product based on performance considerations, effectively negating the 'exclusive' use requirement. This creates an internal contradiction.

section: During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall exclusively play/use the MANDATORY PRODUCT whenever practical. The decision on whether to use the MANDATORY PRODUCT in a specific tournament will be at the sole discretion of the CONSULTANT based on performance considerations. (It is expressly understood by the parties that CONSULTANT may play [* ****] clubs in the bag other than ADAMS GOLF clubs including, but not limited to, a putter by a manufacturer other than ADAMS GOLF but may not endorse those clubs and/or putter.)
explanation: Section 5 allows the consultant to play other clubs, but states that he may not endorse those clubs. But the definition of what constitutes an endorsement is not clearly defined in the document, opening it up to interpretation.

section: CONSULTANT agrees to protect, indemnify and hold ADAMS GOLF harmless from any and all liability, claims, causes of action, suits, damages and expenses (excluding attorneys' fees and expenses) for which it becomes liable or is compelled to pay by reason of a breach of any covenant or representation by CONSULTANT in this Agreement. However, ADAMS GOLF will cover CONSULTANT's attorney fees up to $10,000.
explanation: This section presents a contradiction regarding attorney's fees. The first sentence states that CONSULTANT will indemnify ADAMS GOLF for all liabilities, excluding attorney's fees. However, the second sentence states that ADAMS GOLF will cover CONSULTANT's attorney fees up to $10,000. This creates ambiguity on who is ultimately responsible for the consultant's attorney's fees, and to what extent.
